rComments: Subhas is not a nice person. He is condescending and rude to most of his students. You will have to meet with him often and he will talk over/yell at you the entire time. He'll make you wait outside his office for hours because he is late and then lecture you on time management. If I knew he was the main prof for the TIM major, I would've changed
The workload is no joke. Subhas expects a lot, but his guidelines are clear. He wants you to learn, not just chase grades. The work has definite real-world applications.

This is one of the most helpful classes I've taken but the workload is absolutely insane.  By far the hardest class I've taken.  He also has extremely unrealistic ideas of how much time we should spend on his class.  He will give out homework Tuesday that is due Thursday and expects a 3-4 hour group meeting plus another 6 hours alone in that 2 days

105 and 125 are probably the most work intensive classes I had at UCSC. Subhas expects a lot out of you from the start. The group project is important and he will know if you guys are not meeting to solve problems. He's very clear on what he wants delivered. Go to class and take EXCELLENT notes.
most useful professor at Baskin School if Engineering. knows what he wants and tells you exactly how to do it. just follow his guidelines and you will do well.
Grade: A. Easy class, interesting guest speakers. Two 5-7 page papers. Put in lots of pictures and diagrams. Easy A, hard A+. Professor Desa is a really really great person and teacher.

Come to class, take notes, do the work required, and you'll do fine. He will notice when you're doing the work and making improvements, and does not take well to excuses. Ideally one of the better professors I've had at UCSC.

I worked harder in this class than any other course I've ever taken.  Lots of HW, midterm and final are very time consuming.  That being said I learned more in this class than any other course I've taken.  Subhas is excellent!!  He really cares about his students and wants to see everyone succeed.  He has tons of industry experience.

Taken a number of classes with Subhas (125,225,101) and I'm grateful I did.  Everything and I mean everything I learned in the class was applicable to real world scenarios.  It has prepared me for the real world to come and in the current internship I'm doing all the material I've learned has tied in nicely.  ALOT OF HW!!!! But worth it in the end.
Great Professor, sometimes hard to talk to however he provides lots of information and is very helpful towards personal goals. Again, great professor overall!
SOOOO. MUCH. HOMEWORK. Pretty strict on grading the midterm (but allowed for corrections). I hope he's easier on grading the final and final project...

This class is LOADS of work, which is what makes the class hard--not the concepts. Everything takes a long time to do. If Subhas sees you making an effort in his class and see's your improvement, you will definitely get a good grade. He really wants you to succeed. He's my favorite professor at UCSC.

Far and away the best teacher I've ever had. Knows EVERYTHING about his subject and way more. Genuinely wants you to succeed and will help you, but not do things for you. You work a LOT in 105 (and 125), but the work is interesting and it's stuff you actually use when you're working out in the world.

Subhas Desa is a true gem at UCSC. I took his ISM 105 class and it was fantastic. It was truly one of the best classes I've ever taken at UCSC. You learn a lot of extremely useful skills. But it's not easy, be prepared to work up to 6-8 hours of homework per week. He also expects results and "doing the right things, right"

I had my internship sponsored by Subhas. Overall he's a pretty good guy. Might be a little condescending at times. But he is undoubtedly a smart man and knows what really matters. He gave sound, but broad advice whenever I showed him my papers. Other than that, he's relatively easy and doesn't demand a whole lot, as long as you learn something

THE BEST TEACHER at UCSC; hands down. I got more out of this class (and the 105 course) than everything else at UCSC combined. Super clear, helpful, interesting, and all around a great guy. But save your sob stories, he expects results.
Subhas knows his content and is connected deep into the Silicon Valley's major players.  He is an excellent lecturer to know and I really enjoyed my time with him.

Very good intro to ISM 105 if you plan on taking 105. People complain about it being too hard, but it's just his style of teaching.  He shows you the best possible example and then lets you decide how much time and effort you will put into it.  He never once says "you need to make it like this" people just cry when they realize how useless they are

This class is an obscene time commitment between the average of 5-8 hours per week on hw assignments and the massive project. Didn't use the textbook much, so I didn't buy it.  Does not post notes anywhere so you HAVE to go to class.  This is a methodology class, I learned more about how to approach new problems than in any other class.

this class is useless.he talks a lot and is very vague about the topics. you can ask him one question and he will go on for days and start making no sense.asks too much from students during summer session, requiring a lot of out of class time.he is pretty much useless when it comes to asking questions

ISM 101 was great! I highly recommend this seminar to all. Guests lecturers come in and explain their daily operations as a big time CIO, CFO, or manager. You are "graded" on 2 papers that compile up to about 1800 words. This is an easy A.

he knows his stuff, writes out all the notes for you and has plenty of examples. this class's hw took an extremely long time, and the main project took up a lot of time outside of class. a lot was required. the ta was much more helpful than he was, and he's kind of intimidating. tests were open notes.

Seriously, worst prof. I've ever had.  Very ambiguous, keeps students 20 minutes late and gets upset if someone gets up to leave even though they have another class starting.  Extremely hard and way too much work for a class on this subject.
He's a great teacher, you learn a lot, and he's always ready to help.
He be a bad man. but overall you learn a lot from this class.
